result.execSummary:
The defendant Pernell D Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Release for standard conditions and release for work, work search and treatment. Sentence credit of 23 days were granted if imposed.
Concurrent with: Count 3 and case 21CM2000

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Inform agent of all prescriptions.  Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Cases 22CF444, 22CF1185 and 22CF1557 were dismissed and read in. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
2:52 PM Defendant Pernell D Evans in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Pernell D Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1 and #3. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1 and #3. Counts #2, #4-7, and cases 22CF444, 22CF1185, and 22CF1157 are dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:

COUNT #1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS/RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  (Credit - 23 days).  
Concurrent to: Count #3 and Case 21CM2000.

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS
Concurrent to: Count #3 and Case 21CM2000.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. 
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation. Cash bond posted to be refunded to poster. 

Appeal rights given. 

COUNT#3:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS/RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  (Credit - 23 days).  
Concurrent to: Count #1 and Case 21CM2000.

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS
Concurrent to: Count #1 and Case 21CM2000.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Same as count #1. 

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation. Cash bond posted to be refunded to poster. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. Appeal rights given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

CASH BOND AMENDED TO $1000.00.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

2:22 PM Defendant Pernell D Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Pernell D Evans. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Defense advises that counsel that was covering previous hearing set for plea/sentencing, but bail motion should have been set re: bail motion filed on 10/18/2022 on 22CF1557.

State is ready to proceed on Bail Motion. 
Defense makes arguments in support of Motion for Bail Modification on 22CF1557 and 22CF1609, specifically requesting lower cash bail and/or a signature bond. 
State makes arguments in opposition to any modification to bond. 
Defendant's girlfriend makes statements. 

For reasons stated on the record, the Court will grant the motion to modify bond. 
Bond on 22CF1557: Cash bond lowered to $200.00.
Bond on 22CF1609: Cash bond lowered to $1000.00

Defense requests a short plea/sentencing hearing. Courts sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
